bibl.title: Letter from James E. Peabody to Howard A. Kelly, January 16, 1928

div1.p: Peabody informs Kelly of the progress of the yellow fever pension proposal. He seeks photographs for a lecture.

div1.head: Letter from James E. Peabody to Howard A. Kelly, January 16, 1928

opener.dateline:
The Morris High School
166TH ST. AND BOSTON ROAD
NEW YORK CITY
----o----
THE MORRIS SERVICE LEAGUE
JAMES E. PEABODY
CHAIRMAN THE TEACHER'S COMMITTEE
January 16, 1928.

div1.p:
If you have the time and patience to glance over some of
the enclosed material, you will see that the cause of the
Yellow Fever Heroes is making pretty good progress. I say/
Mr. Charles A. Greathouse, the Democratic leader in Indiana,
yesterday, and he promises us his full support.

I am writing to ask you if it is possible to get the follow-
ing photographs that appear in your book for use in making slides
for my American Museum lecture: Dr. Carlos Finlay, Surgeon Genera
Sternberg, General Gorgas, and General Wood. I shall much ap-
preciate any help you can give me.
Please remember me to Mrs. Kelly.
div1.closer:
Cordially yours, James E. Peabody.
P.S. Would it be possible to get the pictures
in season for my lecture on Jan. 26?
J. P
